intro: Galium fuscum subsp. hypadenium, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its mild astringent properties.
